Actress Kym Marsh has revealed how she paid tribute to her own stillborn son in heartbreaking Coronation Street scenes for which she received widespread praise. 
Kym and her then-partner, Hollyoaks actor Jamie Lomas, tragically lost their son Archie in 2009 when he was born prematurely at 21 weeks. 
In January this year, art imitated life for Kym as her Coronation Street character Michelle Connor gave birth to a stillborn son, Ruairi, at 23 weeks in devastating scenes with co-star Simon Gregson, who plays Steve McDonald. 
Kym, 40, revealed how she paid her own special secret tribute to her son in the soap during an acceptance speech at the TRIC awards on Tuesday. Viewers wept as they watched Michelle say and Steve say goodbye to their son (Photo: ITV) 
She said: "The chain I’m wearing now is the chain you saw Michelle wrap around Ruairi’s wrist, but my children bought me this for Mother’s Day last year to represent Archie. 
“It’s the exact same chain, so that was a really poignant moment for me. I’ve worn this as Michelle since my children gave it to me, so it was a coincidence really in a sense that they wanted Michelle to wrap it around the wrist of the baby." Kym picked up an award at the TRIC Awards this week (Photo: Getty) 
Kym also revealed at the awards that she was "absolutely delighted" with the way the storyline was received. 
"It was obviously something very close to mine and Simon's heart," she added. Read More Coronation Street spoiler: Michelle’s finally going to be happy, says Kym Marsh 
"All we wanted to do was tell the story truthfully and reach out to people, to make a difference some how and we’ve definitely done that." 
The actress is campaigning for stillborns to have birth certificates and has now planned an event in memory of her son, which she has named the Archie Ball. 
When asked what is next for her character Michelle, she said fans will "see some happiness for her at some point." Like us on Facebook
